version_id.description: ID of the Evaluator version to log against.
version_id.title: Version ID.

environment.description: Name of the Environment identifying a deployed version to log to.
environment.title: Environment

path.title: Evaluator path
path.description: Path of the Evaluator, including the name. This locates the Evaluator in the Humanloop filesystem and is used as as a unique identifier. For example: `folder/name` or just `name`.

output.title: Output
output.description: Generated output from the LLM. Only populated for LLM Evaluator Logs.

created_at.title: Created at
created_at.description: User defined timestamp for when the log was created.

error.title: Error
error.description: Error message if the log is an error.

provider_latency.title: Log latency
provider_latency.description: Duration of the logged event in seconds.

provider_request.description:
<llm-instruction>This part of the input schema is truncated. If you want to pass the property `provider_request` to the tool, first call the tool `expandSchema` with "/properties/provider_request" in the list of pointers. This will return the expanded input schema which you can then use in the tool call. You may have to call `expandSchema` multiple times if the schema is nested.</llm-instruction>
<property-description>Raw request sent to provider. Only populated for LLM Evaluator Logs.</property-description>

provider_response.description:
<llm-instruction>This part of the input schema is truncated. If you want to pass the property `provider_response` to the tool, first call the tool `expandSchema` with "/properties/provider_response" in the list of pointers. This will return the expanded input schema which you can then use in the tool call. You may have to call `expandSchema` multiple times if the schema is nested.</llm-instruction>
<property-description>Raw response received the provider. Only populated for LLM Evaluator Logs.</property-description>

inputs.description:
<llm-instruction>This part of the input schema is truncated. If you want to pass the property `inputs` to the tool, first call the tool `expandSchema` with "/properties/inputs" in the list of pointers. This will return the expanded input schema which you can then use in the tool call. You may have to call `expandSchema` multiple times if the schema is nested.</llm-instruction>
<property-description>The inputs passed to the prompt template.</property-description>

source.title: Source
source.description: Identifies where the model was called from.

metadata.description:
<llm-instruction>This part of the input schema is truncated. If you want to pass the property `metadata` to the tool, first call the tool `expandSchema` with "/properties/metadata" in the list of pointers. This will return the expanded input schema which you can then use in the tool call. You may have to call `expandSchema` multiple times if the schema is nested.</llm-instruction>
<property-description>Any additional metadata to record.</property-description>

parent_id.title: Parent ID
parent_id.description: Identifier of the evaluated Log. The newly created Log will have this one set as parent.

source_datapoint_id.title: Source Datapoint ID
source_datapoint_id.description: Unique identifier for the Datapoint that this Log is derived from. This can be used by Humanloop to associate Logs to Evaluations. If provided, Humanloop will automatically associate this Log to Evaluations that require a Log for this Datapoint-Version pair.

trace_parent_id.title: Trace Parent ID
trace_parent_id.description: The ID of the parent Log to nest this Log under in a Trace.

user.title: End-user identifier
user.description: End-user ID related to the Log.

b_environment.title: Environment name
b_environment.description: The name of the Environment the Log is associated to.

save.title: Save
save.description: Whether the request/response payloads will be stored on Humanloop.

log_id.title: Log ID
log_id.description: This will identify a Log. If you don't provide a Log ID, Humanloop will generate one for you.

marked_completed.title: Marked Completed
marked_completed.description: Whether the Log has been manually marked as completed by a user.

attributes.title: Attributes
attributes.description: Additional fields to describe the Evaluator. Helpful to separate Evaluator versions from each other with details on how they were created or used.

options.title: Options
options.description: The options that can be applied as judgments. Only for Evaluators with `return_type` of 'boolean', 'select' or 'multi_select'.

options.title: Options
options.description: The options that can be applied as judgments. Only for Evaluators with `return_type` of 'boolean', 'select' or 'multi_select'.

code.title: Code
code.description: The code for the Evaluator. This code will be executed in a sandboxed environment.

return_type.title: Return type
return_type.description: The type of the return value of the Evaluator.

attributes.title: Attributes
attributes.description: Additional fields to describe the Evaluator. Helpful to separate Evaluator versions from each other with details on how they were created or used.

options.title: Options
options.description: The options that can be applied as judgments.

instructions.title: Instructions
instructions.description: Instructions and guidelines for applying judgments.

attributes.description: Additional fields to describe the Evaluator. Helpful to separate Evaluator versions from each other with details on how they were created or used.

options.title: Options
options.description: The options that can be applied as judgments. Only for Evaluators with `return_type` of 'boolean', 'select' or 'multi_select'.
